page.title: 05Grange Farm, Kesgrave
page.content: Grange Farm is one of the farms in the Kesgrave area. The farmer owns about 600 acres of land, yet he only employs 6 people. He has owned the farm for only one year. He inherited the farm when his father died. The farmer sprays his crops to help them grow as well as to kill pests and kill weeds. He once found a 5000 year old sickle in his fields which came from Northern England. The land was heathland originally and the farm used to be divided into many small fields but now the farm has only a few large fields although there may be more than one crop growing in each. The main crops are barley, oats, rye, sugar beet and potatoes.
